post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body: it may be just me, but I'd say id is selling out by taking popular IP's & putting them on their DnD style RPG game, just to get extra cash. Orces & Elves was new, but now it's "game X RPG!". When's the Quake RPG come out?

post.author: chiapas
post.body: Aww, I don't know. You can't fault someone for their output level. They're just making games, a lot of games. Sure, they do re-use the same IPs over and over. I guess that means that it's easier to write engines than it is to create new fictions. but perhaps the two go hand in hand, and there is something implicit in the process that says that you should also dream something new up each time.

post.author: Deadite4
post.body: Most every game company out there does the same thing. Blizzard has been cycling through 3 IP's for the last ~15 years.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
it may be just me, but I'd say id is selling out by taking popular IP's & putting them on their DnD style RPG game, just to get extra cash. Orces & Elves was new, but now it's "game X RPG!". When's the Quake RPG come out?


They are a company and capitalize their intellectual property. Their sole purpose is to be successful, which gets measured in cash after all. With development cost propelling into movie production levels (without even having to recriut one of these 10 Million per move stars) I'm happy to hear they rely on thier own equity rather than borrowing from the bank or handing their freedom over to a developer. I'd do just the same.
